Hartmut Boesch is Professor of Atmospheric Remote Sensing at the University of Bremen in Germany and works on remote sensing methods of atmospheric composition with a focus in greenhouse gases CO2 and CH4.


## Education

- [PhD in Environmental Physics]{.fw-bold} | University of Heidelberg, Germany | 2002
- [Diploma in Physics and Astronomy ]{.fw-bold} | University of Heidelberg, Germany  | 1998  

## Professional Experience

- [2022-present:]{.fw-bold} Professor, 	University of Bremen, Germany 
- [2007-2022:]{.fw-bold} 	Professor (2017-2022), Reader (2013-2017), Lecturer (2012-2013), Research Fellow (2007-2012), University of Leicester, UK
- [2003-2007:]{.fw-bold} 	Postdoc (2003-2005), Scientist (2006-2007), 	Earth Atmospheric Science, JPL, USA 
- [2002- 2003:]{.fw-bold}	Postodc, University of Heidelberg, Germany\\
